page.title: 02Education in Sheering.
page.content: A{playschool}has been held at the Village Hall for the last 12 years.Six people are employed there.Children attend between the ages of 3 and 5.Twenty children go to playschool from Sheering.Other children come from Sawbridgeworth,Hatfield Broad Oak and Bishop's Stortford. 74 children go to the village{Primary} School.There are 5 teachers,2 of whom work part time.There are three classes in school.Ten years ago there were 6 classes and 180 children.50 children attend from Upper Sheering,22 from Lower Sheering and 2 come from outside the village.Most children walk to school. After the age of ll,children attend {Secondary}Schools in Harlow,Newport,Bishop's Stortford and Sawbridgeworth.Some of these schools provide single-sex education.
